io.t99.caffeinesocket

Class WebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.t99.caffeinesocket.WebSocket

  • public class WebSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    The main WebSocket class.
    Version:
    v0.1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Sears

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.InputStream input
      The InputStream from which the handshake() method reads the client's half of the opening handshake, as well as where a given WebSocket instance's WebSocketListener reads from.
      private WebSocketListener listener
      The WebSocketListener that continously checks a given WebSocket instance's InputStream, input for incoming bytes.
      java.lang.String name
      A String that holds either a passed 'name', or a randomly assigned 'name' used for identification of different WebSockets, as well as for naming the Thread that runs a WebSocketListener.
      private java.io.OutputStream output
      The OutputStream to which the handshake() method writes out this server's half of the opening handshake, as well as where bytes are written out to a given client.
      private int port
      The port on which a given WebSocket instance will listen.
      private boolean secure 
      private java.net.ServerSocket socket
      The ServerSocket that acts as the 'Socket' in 'WebSocket'.
      static java.lang.String WS_GUID
      The globally unique identifier (GUID) used to authenticate the WebSocket connection.

      WebSocket()

    • Field Detail

      • WS_GUID

        public static final java.lang.String WS_GUID
        The globally unique identifier (GUID) used to authenticate the WebSocket connection. As outlined in [RFC6455], WS_GUID holds the GUID '258EAFA5-E914-47DA-95CA-C5AB0DC85B11'.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • port

        private int port
        The port on which a given WebSocket instance will listen.

      • socket

        private java.net.ServerSocket socket
        The ServerSocket that acts as the 'Socket' in 'WebSocket'.

      • input

        private java.io.InputStream input
        The InputStream from which the handshake() method reads the client's half of the opening handshake, as well as where a given WebSocket instance's WebSocketListener reads from.

      • output

        private java.io.OutputStream output
        The OutputStream to which the handshake() method writes out this server's half of the opening handshake, as well as where bytes are written out to a given client.

      • listener

        private WebSocketListener listener
        The WebSocketListener that continously checks a given WebSocket instance's InputStream, input for incoming bytes.

      • name

        public final java.lang.String name
        A String that holds either a passed 'name', or a randomly assigned 'name' used for identification of different WebSockets, as well as for naming the Thread that runs a WebSocketListener. See WebSocketListener.provideInputStream(InputStream).

      • secure

        private boolean secure
